sentences: Ma kahtlen, kas see on õige.
Ta alati kahtub, kui ta peaks otsustama.
context: The Estonian verb 'kahtlen' means to doubt or to have uncertainty about something. It is the first-person singular present form of the verb 'kahtlama'. The word comes from the root 'kaht-' which relates to doubt or suspicion. In Estonian, this verb can be used when expressing personal uncertainty about a statement, decision, or situation. It's commonly used in contexts where someone is questioning the truthfulness or reliability of something.
